tql.tql:
-- An algorithm that determines positive or negative sentiment from text
SELECT result FROM algorithmia.call_algorithm
  WHERE user='nlp'
  AND algorithm='SentimentAnalysis'
  AND $body='{"document": "I really like Algorithmia!"}'

-- The sample Algorithmia algorithm
SELECT result FROM algorithmia.call_algorithm
  WHERE user='demo'
  AND algorithm='Hello'							-- If using a private algorithm, you must include the full version
  AND $body='"World"'							-- Note that "World" is surrounded by quotation marks just as it is on Algorithmia

operations.description: Check a GH repo for happy or angry commit messages

tql.tql:
-- A more complicated integration that uses GitHub commits as the bodies for Algorithmia
SELECT * FROM 
(SELECT C.commit.message, S.result[0].sentiment
	FROM github.list_commits AS C
		JOIN algorithmia.call_algorithm AS S 
		ON S.$body.document = C.commit.message
	WHERE C.owner='seattlerb'
	AND C.repo='heckle'
	AND S.user='nlp'
 	AND S.algorithm='SentimentAnalysis'
    LIMIT 100)
WHERE (sentiment > 0.2 OR sentiment < -0.2)
ORDER BY sentiment
